title: Various bits and pieces with Pictures

posts.content:
All parts in Wigan, Lancs

Early type 3 straight axle gearbox including shafts, hubs and brake cylinders (Wide 5). £200, now £160

Canterbury Pitt Bulkhead interior including cooker (Door mounted) and original free standing table.
The section directly behind the cargo doors isn't original. Its had a sink cupboard built in the past and a cupboard to house a water tank. Has an electric water pump with period switch.
£550





American Eagle wide5 fuchs. 5.5j with an offset of about 30. Set of 4 in Good condition £600


2.2ltr 911T engine, which is pretty much complete with oil tank, heat exhangers, Bischoff stainless silencer, alternator and 11 blade fan, front mount rubbers and a few new odds and sods like NOS dizzy cap and points.
The carbs are Zenith 40TIN which will need some work to them. Rebuild kits are pretty easy to find for these
I believe it had been fitted to a Bay before I got it and has a front mount fitted to suit this and the fly wheel/clutch combo allows fitment to VW box (I was told this but haven't bolted in onto anything). Looking for around £1k



Razor Edge engine lid. Really good condition with no rot and very little rust (What is there is cosmetic) £40, now £35


Talbot Berlin Stainless mirror fitted to an arm that would suit LHD car. Excellent condition. £40 £35


Pair of NOS Rossi Headlight rims. They are the metal rims not the dodgy plastic ones. Still boxed - SOLD




Pair of aftermarket twinport cylinder shrouds. Good condition - Sold


Empi alloy pulley. £20 posted


Brake shoe linings. Suit type 3, type 4, 1302/3's and KG's (upto 70) - £5


Vacuum advance dizzy. Came out of a 63 type 3. Worked when in car -£5

[/b]

Also might sell a pair of OG splitty safari frames and glass. Frames had been brazed together by some muppet so need a little work to the ends (reletively easy fix)
SOLD

Any pics of the safari frames and glass you could send ( iain.cooper@gmail.com )
Cheers,
Iain

Will do Iain but it'll be a day or so before I can get to them

Cheers
Keith
I will have the Rossi headlight rims please...............

No probs! Cheers Keith.
Will await them patiently
Interested in the rims. Any centre caps and are you going to GOTH this weekend? Cheers

Jayfor,
Postage on the Rossi's is £5.

Paypal address in keithsaddy@talktalk.net Thanks

Flat930
No Centre caps. I'm not going to Goth but its only 15minutes from me so I could call up with the wheels.

Cheers
Keith

Oops, forgot

I also have a set of dropped spindles for ball joint type1. Will fit any drum braked Beetle from 67 onwards and any karmann ghia fom 66 onwards.
They're also ok for trekkers and type 3's but I don't know what years they swapped to ball joints.

Comes with all the wheel bearings and track rod ends needed to fit these.
£150

jvm wrote:
Jayfor,
Postage on the Rossi's is £5.


Thanks keith, is it only Paypal you do. Havn't got enough in my Paypal account but can send a cheque and wait for it if thats ok, but will need your address if poss.........

Hi

I will buy the safari glass and frames if Tridau doesn't have them.

Dave

07834805420

LORD JAYFOR wrote:
jvm wrote:
Jayfor,
Postage on the Rossi's is £5.


Thanks keith, is it only Paypal you do. Havn't got enough in my Paypal account but can send a cheque and wait for it if thats ok, but will need your address if poss.........


Cheque is fine. I'll PM address

To all those who have asked for more info and pics of the safari frames, sorry but these are now provisionally sold. I'll let you know if the sale falls through

Cheers
Keith

Also got a set of 4 splitty wheels with really good tyres.

Wheels are 14 inch and powder coated in Off White. Powder coating is good but was done over 10years ago so not perfect any more. Tyres are 185 radial commercial tyres with loads of tread - probably no more than about 3000miles on them. Although they are a modern radial, the tread suits the van if you get what I mean

£100

Hi jvm,just asking if you have any front seats that will fit my samba,either 2&1 or full length..Am new to the scene & just got the split,so going to start to do her up.....also looking to buy some door locks with keys.any help would be great,cheers simon
